p:
The esterification activity (EA) catalyzed by the crude enzymatic extracts was followed by modified titrimetric assays [ 32]. The esterification activity of crude enzymatic extracts was measured by the consumption of acid in the esterification reaction with ethanol and oleic acid (1:1 equimolar ratio). Experiments were carried out in Erlenmeyer flasks (125 mL) containing 5 mL of reaction medium. The reaction was initiated by the addition of 1 mL of the enzymatic extract. Experimentally, a control assay (blank) was consistently performed. After incubation in shaker for 120 min at 40°C and 180 rpm, the content of fatty acids remaining in the aliquot was extracted by the addition of 15 mL of an acetone/ethanol solution (1:1, v/v). The amount of oleic acid was then titrated with 0.1 M NaOH up to pH 11. One unit of lipase activity was defined as the amount of dry enzyme preparation necessary for the consumption of 1 μmol.min −1 of acid under assay conditions. All assays were performed in duplicate, and the results are expressed in terms of units per gram of dry substrate and calculated as follows:
(1)
E A =
V a − V b
x
M

100
E

t
where Va is volume of NaOH used after 120 min (mL); Vb is volume of NaOH used at zero time of reaction (mL); M is molarity of NaOH solution; t is time (min).
